article_title: Obama’s Legacy: Politics of Anger, Fights, Division
article_text: Fist fights at campaign rallies. A major presidential candidate called a bigot and bully by members of his own party. Gridlock in Washington. And Americans downright pessimistic. This is America’s politics today, seven years after Barack Obama was elected president with a promise to change it all. The political change he predicted never appeared. Instead, partisanship and dysfunction have grown worse. His legacy on policies is more mixed. He did accomplish things, notably the Affordable Care Act. But his legacy on politics is another story. Read more here: http://www.mcclatchydc.com/news/politics-government/white-house/article74647642.html#storylink=cpy

article_summary:
This is America’s politics today, seven years after Barack Obama was elected president with a promise to change it all.
But his legacy on politics is another story.
A major presidential candidate called a bigot and bully by members of his own party.
Fist fights at campaign rallies.
His legacy on policies is more mixed.
